alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 3:50PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Apache and Navajo counties near Show Low. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on highways and in populated areas will create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has ended, however minor flooding remains possible from earlier rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Silver Creek, Billy Creek, Brown Creek, Rocky Arroyo, Show Low Creek and Porter Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Show Low, Scott Reservoir Campground and Fool Hollow Lake Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 345 and 346. Highway 60 between mile markers 340 and 354. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 354. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 349. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
